title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 13 May 2008 - XWiki
content:

vanksi - (13/05/2008 10:45): having some problems with stable+mod\_jk  
vanksi - (13/05/2008 10:45): getting random 'service temporarily unavailable" messages  
vanksi - (13/05/2008 10:45): using the zip package  
xwikibot - (13/05/2008 11:46): Community.BuildingInEclipse was modified by xwiki:XWiki.sub1236 - http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/BuildingInEclipse  
xipe - (13/05/2008 11:46): which version of mod\_jk are you using ?  
xipe - (13/05/2008 11:46): can't you use mod\_proxy\_ajp (which is the newer httpd<->tomcat connector) ?  
xipe - (13/05/2008 11:47): also vanksi have you mod\_security activated ?  
xwikibot - (13/05/2008 11:48): Community.BuildingInEclipse was modified by xwiki:XWiki.sub1236 (Rollback to version 108.1) - http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/BuildingInEclipse  
xwikibot - (13/05/2008 12:01): Plugins.DocumentTreePlugin was modified by xwiki:XWiki.ThomasMortagne (Added comment) - http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Plugins/DocumentTreePlugin  
xwikibot - (13/05/2008 12:02): Plugins.DocumentTreePlugin was modified by xwiki:XWiki.ThomasMortagne - http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Plugins/DocumentTreePlugin  
jvelociter\_ - (13/05/2008 12:03): Hi guy  
jvelociter\_ - (13/05/2008 12:04): did somebody already used  a "List of users" class field with $doc.display ?  
jvelociter\_ - (13/05/2008 12:04): (successfully :))  
thomasmortagne - (13/05/2008 12:05): jvelociter\_: if I correctly understand you question, wiki manager user this kind of list in wiki descriptor class  
thomasmortagne - (13/05/2008 12:06): and so in wiki descriptor sheet page  
thomasmortagne - (13/05/2008 12:07): but this filed is not very well displayed and should be completely rewritten I think  
jvelociter\_ - (13/05/2008 12:07): ok I just did it, but we have to force the mode to display  
jvelociter\_ - (13/05/2008 12:07): like $doc.display("field", $object) does not work  
jvelociter\_ - (13/05/2008 12:08): but $doc.display("field","edit", $object) does  
xwikibot - (13/05/2008 12:14): AdminGuide.Authentication was modified by xwiki:XWiki.ThomasMortagne - http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication

xwikibot - (13/05/2008 19:02): Drafts.WritingGWTApplicationsInXWiki was modified by xwiki:XWiki.mflorea - http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/WritingGWTApplicationsInXWiki  
SaiKrishna - (13/05/2008 19:34): Hi Davi  
SaiKrishna - (13/05/2008 19:34): Hi David  
dward - (13/05/2008 19:34): Hello.  
SaiKrishna - (13/05/2008 19:35): fews doubts deploying lucene search   
SaiKrishna - (13/05/2008 19:36): do I need to start writing search page and results page OR any default pages are provided ?  
dward - (13/05/2008 19:37): Yes, I believe that there are default pages provided for search, but you would need them anyway to make sure it is working.  
SaiKrishna - (13/05/2008 19:38): where can get those default pages ?  
SaiKrishna - (13/05/2008 19:38): checked bin/view/Main/LuceneSearch , but there is no page with this title  
dward - (13/05/2008 19:41): It looks like it is in xwiki enterprise, but not xwiki standard.  
dward - (13/05/2008 19:41): ./xwiki-product-enterprise/wiki/src/main/resources/Main/LuceneSearch  
dward - (13/05/2008 19:47): But I would suggest just creating a new page on your installation for now.  
SaiKrishna - (13/05/2008 19:52): I was checking a blog on "Improving XWiki Search " @ http://encodo.com/en/blogs.php?entry\_id=123 ; It says pages like bin/Main/Panels, bin/Main/Results exists, but I do have such page created by default  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 19:54): SaiKrishna: What exactly are you building?  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 19:54): Those pages exist when building xwiki-product-enterprise  
SaiKrishna - (13/05/2008 19:54): just trying to get lucene search textbox in rightside panel   
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 19:54): xwiki-platform-web does not have any pages  
SaiKrishna - (13/05/2008 19:55): I have build the source code using -xe option   
dward - (13/05/2008 19:56): http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation describes how to import the XAR file that would contain the pages.  
SaiKrishna - (13/05/2008 19:56): ok  
SaiKrishna - (13/05/2008 19:57): after building with -xe opition, I used the war file in xwiki-product-enterprise/web/target -- any thing wrong ??  
dward - (13/05/2008 19:58): What are you using to run the war?  What db are you using?  
SaiKrishna - (13/05/2008 19:58): HSQLDB  
SaiKrishna - (13/05/2008 19:59): I have successfully depolyed  it and  lucene is also able to  index the articles(check lucene index)  
SaiKrishna - (13/05/2008 20:00): \*checked lucene index  
dward - (13/05/2008 20:00): So you probably just have to import the XAR file.  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 20:00): The web does not contain any documents, you should either import xwiki-product-enterprise/wiki/target/\*.xar, or unzip xwiki-product-enterprise/distribution/hsqldb/target/\*.zip and run start\_xwiki.sh  
SaiKrishna - (13/05/2008 20:01): ok  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 20:02): vmassol: xipe: Ping  
vmassol - (13/05/2008 20:02): sdumitriu: hold on, bb in 10  
SaiKrishna - (13/05/2008 20:14): David , Sergiu :: Is this correct ??  -- change some code (core or plugin) -- compile using -xe opition -- use  xwiki-product-enterprise/distribution/hsqldb/target/\*.zip , to deploy wiki  -- dont bother about other files(like web/target/\*.war file, wiki/target/\*.xar file)  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 20:15): Yes  
SaiKrishna - (13/05/2008 20:15): ok  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 20:15): It usually takes a lot of time, so after expanding the zip folder, I just build what I want and manually copy it in the right place  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 20:16): Something like:  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 20:16): mvn install -o && cp target/xwiki-core-1.5-SNAPSHOT.jar ../../xwiki-product-enterprise/distribution/hsqldb/target/xwiki-enterprise-hsqldb-1.5-SNAPSHOT/webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib/  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 20:16): (in xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-core)  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 20:16): Or:  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 20:16): mvn install -o && cp target/xwiki-plugin-lucene-1.2-SNAPSHOT.jar ../../xwiki-product-enterprise/distribution/hsqldb/target/xwiki-enterprise-hsqldb-1.5-SNAPSHOT/webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib/  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 20:16): (in plugins/lucene)  
SaiKrishna - (13/05/2008 20:17): ok   
SaiKrishna - (13/05/2008 20:18): instead of building complete enterprise I can just build of the required plugin/part and update my xwiki  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 20:18): Right  
SaiKrishna - (13/05/2008 20:18): ok  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 20:46): vmassol: Back?  
vmassol - (13/05/2008 22:06): sdumitriu: just for a few minutes  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 22:06): Shortly: the PDF looping bug is solved in fop-0.95beta  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 22:06): I tested locally to update the fop and xml-graphics-commons jars and nothing seems to be broken  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 22:07): The syntax page is exported correctly  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 22:07): Other pages seem to be exported a bit faster  
vmassol - (13/05/2008 22:08): sdumitriu: cool, that should go in 1.5M1 IMO  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 22:08): The problem is that it is a beta release, although it appears on the maven repo  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 22:09): Should we use it?  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 22:09): + it should be used on our farms  
vmassol - (13/05/2008 22:09): I'm fine with 1.5M1 but sounds too dangerous for 1.4  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 22:09): Yes, 1.4 should no be updated  
vmassol - (13/05/2008 22:09): it could go in 1.4.1 later on if stable  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 22:09): But we can manually upgrade the farms  
vmassol - (13/05/2008 22:09): yes  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 22:09): To see how it behaves  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 22:09): Are you back in .fr?  
vmassol - (13/05/2008 22:11): yes  
vmassol - (13/05/2008 22:11): still a bit jetlagged but back  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 22:13): Stupid spammers...  
vmassol - (13/05/2008 22:13): yeah  
vmassol - (13/05/2008 22:13): I changed their pwd  
vmassol - (13/05/2008 22:15): got to go, talk to you tomorrow  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2008 22:16): Bye
